body_html: tf.verify_tensor_all_finite() actually expects a single tensor. If you happen to pass in a list of identically-sized N-dimensional tensors, TensorFlow will pack them into a single N+1-dimensional tensor and pass that to the op.
body_text: tf.verify_tensor_all_finite() actually expects a single tensor. If you happen to pass in a list of identically-sized N-dimensional tensors, TensorFlow will pack them into a single N+1-dimensional tensor and pass that to the op.
body: `tf.verify_tensor_all_finite()` actually expects a _single_ tensor. If you happen to pass in a list of identically-sized N-dimensional tensors, TensorFlow will pack them into a single N+1-dimensional tensor and pass that to the op.
